column4: as with all debian library packages, libBLA is the actual compiled library used by depending programs, libBLA-dev is the source headers you NEED to compile stuff against it, and libBLA-bin is auxiliary executables to go with it.
do i need bin
unlikely.
manual inst is something ex-windows users think they need to do
why do they think they need to do that
because that is what they are used to doing
is there any value in it... honestly?
no
but you can do it all within synaptic...
if you know what you need to do you can do it quicker with apt-get/aptitude command line
thanks
no, just backport the deb
you basically just get the source PACKAGE for e.g. jaunty 9.04 (not the original .tar.gz) and rebuild it for 8.10
most of the time it works fine
and you can then just deploy that .deb file
but WHY?
it's less work, actually.
you said: libcoin60 is in 9.04, but... are y ou suggesting i do with it what you just said?
if you are going to be developing, i recommend you consider just using 9.04
prevu looks like a piece of cake
you still around?
another thing the repositories does is lump programs that are "dependent" upon each other when they arne't necessarily so
